The Peepal tree, known scientifically as Ficus religiosa, is deeply revered in Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism. It symbolizes longevity, wisdom, and protection and has profound associations with Indian mythology. Ecologically, it's a foundational species that supports biodiversity, purifies air, and offers shade. One mature Peepal tree can generate enough oxygen for 9 to 10 people daily. The Peepal tree, scientifically known as Ficus religiosa, is a foundational species in its habitat with an extensive root system and broad canopy that supports biodiversity by providing shelter and food to numerous birds, insects, and small animals. It is one of the world's most oxygen-producing trees, generating enough oxygen for 9 to 10 people daily.
